template.name: Service Zabbix Server
template.description:
Base Zabbix server monitoring template.
Current version : 1.0 Date: 2017-09-09 Changelog: 1.0: - initial version.
Notes: * Host with this template needs to monitored without any proxy.

item.description: Number of enabled items (supported and not supported).

item.name: process::$4::$2 %
item.description: Average percent of the time of the "alerter" processes process sending notifications (during the last minute).

item.name: process::$4::$2 %
item.description: Average percent of the time "housekeeper" processes which is responsible for removal of old historical data. This metrics should have only two values 0 and 100% because it is only one housekeeper process. When it is 100% it means that housekeeper is active.

item.name: queue::$2
item.description: Number of monitored items in the Queue which are delayed by 1 minute or more.

item.name: queue::$2
item.description: Number of monitored items in the Queue which are delayed by 5 minutes or more.

item.name: queue::$2
item.description: Number of monitored items in the Queue which are delayed by 10s or more.

item.name: queue::$2
item.description: Number of monitored items in the Queue which are delayed by 30s or more.

item.name: items::nvps
item.description: Required performance of the Zabbix server or Zabbix proxy, in new values per second expected.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: Uptime of te Zabbix server process in seconds.

Size of free history cache.
A low number indicates performance problems on the database side.

Percent of free history cache.
A low number indicates performance problems on the database side.
Total size of free history cache.

Size of used history cache.
A high number indicates performance problems on the database side.

Size of free trend cache.
A low number indicates performance problems on the database side.

Percent of free terend cache.
A low number indicates performance problems on the database side.
Total size of free trend cache.

Size of used trend cache.
A high number indicates performance problems on the database side.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::CacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (< 5%)
trigger.description: Consider increasing CacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/CacheSize file.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::CacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (< 15%)
trigger.description: Consider increasing CacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/CacheSize file.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::CacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (> 80%)
trigger.description: Consider decrease CacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/CacheSize file.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::HistoryCacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (< 5%)
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryCacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/HistoryCacheSize file.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::HistoryCacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (< 15%)
trigger.description: Consider increasing HistoryCacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/HistoryCacheSize file.

trigger.name: SVC::zabbix_server::HistoryCacheSize {ITEM.VALUE} free (> 80%)
trigger.description: Consider decrease HistoryCacheSize in the /etc/zabbix/zabbix_server/HistoryCacheSize file.
